meanings.definition: A person who conceives or forms ideas.
meanings.sent1: Teachers are great conceivers of innovative lesson plans.
meanings.sent2: Artists are known as conceivers of beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly called themselves the conceivers of fun adventures.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science fiction, writers are the conceivers of entire universes.
meanings.sent5: Leonardo da Vinci is remembered as one of the greatest conceivers in history.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that conceives or generates something.
meanings.sent1: The computer program acted as a conceivers of complex algorithms.
meanings.sent2: The factory machine is a crucial conceivers of automobile parts.
meanings.sent3: The robotic arm was the unexpected conceivers of chaos in the production line.
meanings.sent4: The telescope is a remarkable conceivers of distant galaxies.
meanings.sent5: The 3D printer is a modern conceivers of intricate designs.

meanings.definition: The act of conceiving or imagining something.
meanings.sent1: Dreaming is a common conceivers during sleep.
meanings.sent2: The brainstorming session was a productive conceivers of new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The magician's show was a magical conceivers of illusions.
meanings.sent4: The art class was a creative conceivers of colorful masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: Imagination is the limitless conceivers of fantastical worlds.
